org.cloudbus.cloudsim.datacenters.power

Class PowerDatacenterNonPowerAware

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core.CloudSimEntity
      • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.datacenters.DatacenterSimple
        • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.datacenters.power.PowerDatacenter
          • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.datacenters.power.PowerDatacenterNonPowerAware
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Runnable, Identificable, Nameable, SimEntity, Datacenter

    public class PowerDatacenterNonPowerAware
extends PowerDatacenter
    PowerDatacenterNonPowerAware is a class that represents a non-power aware data center in the context of power-aware simulations.
    If you are using any algorithms, policies or workload included in the power package please cite the following paper:
    • Anton Beloglazov, and Rajkumar Buyya, "Optimal Online Deterministic Algorithms and Adaptive Heuristics for Energy and Performance Efficient Dynamic Consolidation of Virtual Machines in Cloud Data Centers", Concurrency and Computation: Practice and Experience (CCPE), Volume 24, Issue 13, Pages: 1397-1420, John Wiley & Sons, Ltd, New York, USA, 2012
    Since:
    CloudSim Toolkit 2.0
    Author:
    Anton Beloglazov

    • Method Detail

      • updateCloudletProcessing

        protected void updateCloudletProcessing()
        Description copied from class: DatacenterSimple
        Updates processing of each cloudlet running in this DatacenterSimple and schedules the next processing update. It is necessary because Hosts and VMs are simple objects, not entities. So, they don't receive events and updating cloudlets inside them must be called from the outside.
        Overrides:
        updateCloudletProcessing in class PowerDatacenter
